entry.title: Azerbaijani official threatens to kick out USAID from country

entry.title: The Case for Canadian Arms Exports to Armenia

media:group.media:title: The Case for Canadian Arms Exports to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Senator Leo Houssakos has long advocated for stronger Canadian support for Armenia within the Conservative party. In this interview, Civilnet host Patrick Elliott sits down with the veteran senator as he calls for Ottawa to reconsider its strategic partnership with Armenia. Houssakos discusses Canada's role in the region and makes the case for why bolstering Armenia's defense is crucial to both nations' interests.

entry.title: Exclusive: Armenia declines to say if it considers 2020 ceasefire still in force

media:group.media:title: Exclusive: Armenia declines to say if it considers 2020 ceasefire still in force
media:group.media:description:
üìçA senior Azerbaijani official cast doubt on his country‚Äôs willingness to engage in Western-mediated peace talks with Armenia, amid a widening gulf between Yerevan and Baku over competing European- and Russian-led negotiation tracks. üìçArmenia confirmed it sent Azerbaijan its latest peace treaty proposal. üìçAzerbaijan brought war crimes charges against Rashid Beglaryan, a 61-year-old Armenian civilian from Karabakh held in detention in the country. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry declined to tell CivilNet if it still considered the ceasefire declaration that ended the 2020 Karabakh war to still be in force.

entry.title: Rerooted: Collecting and preserving the stories of Karabakh Armenians

media:group.media:title: Rerooted: Collecting and preserving the stories of Karabakh Armenians
media:group.media:description:
Ani Schug, cofounder of Rerooted, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about how she and her team are working to collect oral histories from Nagorno-Karabakh's Armenians ‚Äî and why now is the right time to do so. Rerooted is a project that preserves testimonies from Armenian communities around the world.
0:00 How is Rerooted working with Artsakh‚Äôs Armenians? 3:53 What can be done to document alleged atrocities? 6:19 Why is now the time to collect testimonies from Artsakh? 9:00 Where is Rerooted going next?

entry.title: ‚ÄúWe owe it to our ancestors and future generations to regroup and rebuild‚Äù, Dr. Garo Armen

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúWe owe it to our ancestors and future generations to regroup and rebuild‚Äù, Dr. Garo Armen
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we delve into Dr. Garo Armen's life, from his childhood experiences in Istanbul to his life as a successful scientist, entrepreneur, and philanthropist in the US and Armenia. We explore some factors and people who inspired him to work, build and succeed in the bio-chemical and biotech industries and his philosophy behind success, leadership, money, power, and the meaning of life. Finally, Dr. Armen shares his view on where the world is headed, the challenges and hardships, and his hopes for the future.
About Dr. Garo Armen Dr. Garo Armen is an American-Armenian scientist, businessman and entrepreneur. He serves as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Agenus Inc., which he co-founded in 1994. He is also the founder of the Children of Armenia Fund (COAF). He currently acts as Chairman of the Board of Protagenic Therapeutics. He has been at the head of seven different companies, most of which are in the business of advancing scientific technologies and immunotherapeutic products in the cure for cancer. Dr. Armen received his Ph.D. in physical chemistry from the City University of New York. In addition, he is the recipient of several prestigious awards and honors, including the Ellis Island Medal of honor for his humanitarian efforts in Armenia and contribution to American society, the Medal of Honor from the Prime Minister of the Republic of Armenia for his contribution in revitalizing rural communities in Armenia, and the Mkhitar Heratsi Medal from the President of Armenia for services to the development of healthcare in Armenia.
Program overview Mindful Leaders dives into the stories of people who have achieved prominence, walked incredible journeys, and have defined culture.
Lara sits down with specialists, thinkers and change-catalysts to deconstruct insights, events and lessons that have shaped their personal and professional lives and have enabled them to create meaning and connection.
#CivilNet #MindfulLeaders #InheritedLegacies
